rules: Rule1: If the alcohol-based treatment requires approval, then it is government approved.
Rule2: Either the alcohol-based treatment is a banned substance, or if it has passed animal testing, then it is not safe for animals.
Rule3: Provided that the alcohol-based treatment is a controlled substance, it is not a banned substance.
Rule4: Under the condition that manufacturing of the alcohol-based treatment is authorized, distribution of it is authorized.
Rule5: Manufacturing of the alcohol-based treatment is authorized or it is government approved.
Rule6: Whenever the alcohol-based treatment requires a veterinary prescription, it is government approved.
Rule7: Provided that the alcohol-based treatment is under regulatory investigation, it has adverse effects.
Rule8: If the alcohol-based treatment is under regulatory investigation, then it is not the case that there are safety concerns regarding it.
Rule9: The alcohol-based treatment is under regulatory investigation or it requires a veterinary prescription.
Rule10: If the alcohol-based treatment is subject to an immediate recall, then it is subject to a voluntary recall.
Rule11: Under the condition that the alcohol-based treatment is subject to a voluntary recall, it is subject to a product recall.
Rule12: Whenever a regulatory hearing is held for the alcohol-based treatment, if it is not government approved, then a special permit is not issued for it.
Rule13: An expert panel is convened for the alcohol-based treatment or an internal review is conducted for it.
Rule14: Under the condition that an internal review is conducted for the alcohol-based treatment, a regulatory hearing is held for it.
Rule15: Whenever a scientific assessment is performed for the alcohol-based treatment, a committee review is conducted for it.
Rule16: A public comment period is open for the alcohol-based treatment or, if an expert panel is convened for it, then a scientific assessment is performed for it.
Rule17: If the alcohol-based treatment is approved for research, then, provided that it does not require approval, it requires an alternative approach.
Rule18: Under the condition that the alcohol-based treatment is under customs hold, it is not a banned substance.
Rule19: Whenever the alcohol-based treatment is subject to trade regulation, if there is an import restriction on it, then it is under customs hold.
Rule20: If a production license is granted for the alcohol-based treatment, then it is quality certified.
Rule21: A production license is granted for the alcohol-based treatment or it has not passed animal testing.
Rule22: Provided that manufacturing of the alcohol-based treatment is suspended, production of it is halted.

Rule23: If a regulatory appeal is filed for the alcohol-based treatment, then, provided that it is not the case that if production of it is halted then manufacturing of it is not authorized, a temporary exemption is granted for it.
Rule24: A regulatory appeal is filed for the alcohol-based treatment or a compliance hearing is held for it.
Rule25: If a compliance hearing is held for the alcohol-based treatment, then an administrative review is conducted for it.
Rule26: Under the condition that an application for the alcohol-based treatment has been submitted, it is approved for research.
Rule27: An application for the alcohol-based treatment has been submitted or it is under fast-track review.

Rule28: Whenever an administrative review is conducted for the alcohol-based treatment, if it is not the case that if production of it is halted then manufacturing of it is not authorized, a temporary exemption is granted for it.
Rule29: Provided that a compliance audit is performed for the alcohol-based treatment, there are safety concerns regarding it.
Rule30: Under the condition that a court ruling is issued for the alcohol-based treatment, a favorable decision is not made for it.

Rule31: A court ruling is issued for the alcohol-based treatment, or a legal challenge is raised against it, or, if it is not the case that if it is under regulatory investigation then a compliance audit is performed for it, then a regulatory fine is not imposed on it.
Rule32: If regulatory approval is granted for the alcohol-based treatment, then market authorization is granted for it.
Rule33: Regulatory approval is granted for the alcohol-based treatment or it is not under regulatory investigation.
Rule34: Under the condition that the alcohol-based treatment is under fast-track review, it is approved for research.
Rule35: Whenever research on the alcohol-based treatment is continuing, development of it is stopped.
Rule36: Provided that funding for the alcohol-based treatment is withdrawn, development of it is not stopped.
Rule37: Funding for the alcohol-based treatment is withdrawn or there are investor concerns about it.
Rule38: If there are investor concerns about the alcohol-based treatment, then it is withdrawn from the market.
Rule39: Provided that a stakeholder meeting is held for the alcohol-based treatment, a public hearing is held for it.
Rule40: A stakeholder meeting is held for the alcohol-based treatment or an industry forum is held for it.
Rule41: Provided that a professional conference is held for the alcohol-based treatment, a committee review is conducted for it or a regulatory hearing is held for it.
Rule42: If a regulatory summit is held for the alcohol-based treatment, then, whenever an industry forum is held for it, a professional conference is held for it.
Rule43: Under the condition that a global conference is held for the alcohol-based treatment, an international symposium is held for it or a regulatory summit is held for it.
Rule44: Whenever a regional meeting is held for the alcohol-based treatment, an international symposium is held for it or a regulatory summit is held for it.
Rule45: Provided that an annual convention is held for the alcohol-based treatment, a global conference is held for it or a regional meeting is held for it.
Rule46: An annual convention is held for the alcohol-based treatment or a quarterly forum is held for it.
Rule47: If a quarterly forum is held for the alcohol-based treatment, then a global conference is held for it or a regional meeting is held for it.
Rule48: Clinical trials for the alcohol-based treatment have been completed, or, if it is authorized for emergency use, then it is government approved.
Rule49: Under the condition that the alcohol-based treatment has passed animal testing, it is safe for animals.
Rule50: The alcohol-based treatment has passed animal testing or clinical trials for it have not been completed.
Rule51: If it is not the case that export of the alcohol-based treatment is approved or distribution of it is not authorized, then it is for domestic use only.
Rule52: Provided that it is not the case that export of the alcohol-based treatment is approved or distribution of it is not authorized, it is not for domestic use only.

Rule53: Under the condition that it is not the case that if the alcohol-based treatment is under regulatory investigation then a compliance audit is performed for it, a regulatory fine is imposed on it.
Rule54: Provided that it is not the case that if the alcohol-based treatment has adverse effects then there are safety concerns regarding it, it is subject to an immediate recall.
Rule55: Under the condition that it is not the case that if the alcohol-based treatment has adverse effects then there are safety concerns regarding it, it is not subject to a product recall.
Rule56: Whenever it is not the case that if an expert panel is convened for the alcohol-based treatment then a scientific assessment is performed for it, research on it is continuing.
Rule57: Provided that it is not the case that if production of the alcohol-based treatment is halted then manufacturing of it is not authorized, a temporary exemption is not granted for it.
Rule58: Under the condition that it is not the case that if a court ruling is issued for the alcohol-based treatment then a favorable decision is made for it, an unfavorable decision is made for it.

Rule59: If it is not the case that if the alcohol-based treatment is the subject of a supreme court case then, if it is not the case that if a court ruling is issued for it then a favorable decision is made for it, then an unfavorable decision is not made for it, then it is precedent setting.

Rule60: Provided that it is not the case that if the alcohol-based treatment is the subject of a supreme court case then, if it is not the case that if a court ruling is issued for it then a favorable decision is made for it, then an unfavorable decision is not made for it, it is not precedent setting.
Rule61: Under the condition that it is not the case that if the alcohol-based treatment is withdrawn from the market then development of it is not stopped, development of it is extended.
Rule62: Whenever the alcohol-based treatment is not government approved, a special permit is issued for it.
facts: Fact1: The alcohol-based treatment is a controlled substance.
Fact2: There is an import restriction on the alcohol-based treatment.
Fact3: The alcohol-based treatment is subject to trade regulation.
Fact4: Manufacturing of the alcohol-based treatment is suspended.
Fact5: The alcohol-based treatment is the subject of a supreme court case.
Fact6: The alcohol-based treatment is authorized for emergency use.
Fact7: Export of the alcohol-based treatment is not approved.
Fact8: The alcohol-based treatment does not require an alternative approach.
Fact9: A committee review is not conducted for the alcohol-based treatment.

Fact14: Development of the alcohol-based treatment is not extended.

Fact16: An international symposium is not held for the alcohol-based treatment.

question: The alcohol-based treatment is government approved.
